result.execSummary:
The defendant Patrick J. Carroll was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If Agent feels defendant has completed probation successfully after 1 year, Court has no objection to early release/discharge.
Concurrent with: with 15CF217 & 15CF288.

miscConds.notes:
DNA surcharge imposed. 
$150 cash bond applied.
Defendant shall obtain/maintain fulltime employment and/or fulltime student status and/or combination of both.

Defendant to have no contact directly or indirectly with David Leitner. 
Defendant to have no contact directly or indirectly with Cody Petrausch unless Agent approves. 
Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages.
Defendant's record shall be expunged per Section 973.015 Wis Stats if probation is successfully completed.

Defendant to pay supervision fees as determined by DOC. 
Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
Granted release privileges under 303.08(1).
Concurrent with: with 15CF217, 15CF288 & with any other sentence.

Violation/Revocation Summary
Sentencing hearing on revocation on October 6, 2016 at 11:15 am.

Defendant Patrick J. Carroll in court with attorney Thomas W. Johnson. 
James H Fassbender appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Restitution addressed in 15CF217.

Defendant Patrick J. Carroll in court (in custody) with attorney Thomas W. Johnson. 
James H Fassbender appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Plea Questionnaire / Waiver of Rights filed with the Court. 
Defendant advised of rights, waives rights and enters no contest plea. 
Per ADA Fassbender, State has completed witness responsibilities. 
Court accepts plea and finds defendant guilty. 
Court orders sentence withheld, probation 2 years, concurrent with 15CF217 & 15CF288. 
Conditions: 
- pay costs/supervision fees 
- submit to assessments/counseling and abide by recommendations 
- not possess/consume any alcoholic beverages 
- obtain/maintain full time employment and/or fulltime student status and/or combination of both 
- no contact directly/indirectly with David Leitner 
- no contact directly/indirectly with Cody Petrausch unless Agent approves 
- expungement upon successful completion of probation 
- if Agent feels defendant has completed probation successfully after 1 year, Court has no objection to early release/discharge 
Defendant provided with Notice of Appeal rights.
